class CBD.Core.BaseBlock(name, input_ports, output_ports)[source]¶

Bases: object

A base class for all types of basic blocks

Parameters:
  • name (str) – The name of the block. When empty, a CBD.util.hash64() encoded name of the instance id() will be used.
  • input_ports (iter) – List of input port names (strings).
  • output_ports (iter) – List of output port names (strings).

Adds an input port if there is no port with the given name.

Parameters:name (str) – The name of the port.
addOutputPort(name)[source]¶

Adds an output port if there is no port with the given name.

Parameters:name (str) – The name of the port.

getClock()[source]¶

Gets the simulation clock. Only works if the block is part of a CBD model.

appendToSignal(value, name_output=None)[source]¶

Appends the value to the set of obtained signals and links it to the current simulation time.

Parameters:
  • value (Any) – The value to append.
  • name_output (str) – The name of the output port. If not set, or None, the value of OUT1 will be used.

Helper function to help the creation of the dependency graph.

Parameters:curIteration (int) – The current simulation’s iteration, for which the dependency graph must be constructed.
getBlockConnectedToInput(input_port)[source]¶

Get the block that is connected to a specific input.

Parameters:input_port (str) – The name of the input port.
getInputSignal(curIteration=-1, input_port='IN1')[source]¶

Returns the signal sent out by the input block.

Parameters:
  • curIteration (int) – The iteration at which the signal is obtained. When None or -1, the last value will be used.
  • input_port (str) – The name of the input port. If omitted, or when None, the value of IN1 will be used.
getPath(sep='.')[source]¶

Gets the path of the current block. This includes the paths from its parents. When the block has no parents i.e. when it’s the top-level block, the block’s name is returned.

Parameters:sep (str) – The separator to use. Defaults to .
Returns:The full path as a string.

Examples

A block called grandchild, which is located in the child CBD, that in its turn is located in this CBD has a path of child.grandchild.

compute(curIteration)[source]¶

Computes this block’s operation, based on its inputs and store it as an output signal.

Parameters:curIteration (int) – The iteration at which we must compute this value.
linkInput(in_block, name_input=None, name_output=None)[source]¶

Links the output of the from_block to the input of the to_block.

Parameters:
  • in_block (BaseBlock) – The block that must be linked.
  • name_input (str) – The name of the input port. When None or omitted, the next input port is used. E.g. if the last port was IN1, the input is assumed to be IN2.
  • name_output (str) – The name of the output port. Defaults to OUT1.
info(indent=0)[source]¶

Returns a string with the block’s details.

Parameters:indent (int) – The amount of indentation that is required at the start of each line. Defaults to 0.

class CBD.Core.CBD(block_name, input_ports=None, output_ports=None)[source]¶

Bases: CBD.Core.BaseBlock

The CBD class, contains an entire Causal Block Diagram Call the run function to simulate the model.

(Deep) copies the current block, ignoring all connections or links that were set on this block.

getTopCBD()[source]¶

Finds the highest-level CBD instance.

flatten(parent=None, ignore=None, psep='.')[source]¶

Flatten the CBD parent and call flatten recursively for CBD’s in this CBD

Parameters:
  • parent (CBD) – Reference to the parent. Used for the recursive call. Defaults to None. Users should ignore this parameter.
  • ignore (iter) – Block class names to ignore in the flattening. When None, no blocks are ignored. Defaults to None.
  • psep (str) – The path separator to use. Defaults to ".".

Gets the list of blocks.

Gets a block by its name.

Parameters:name (str) – The block’s name
hasBlock(name)[source]¶

Checks if the CBD has a block with the given name.

Parameters:name (str) – The name of the block to check.
clearBlocks()[source]¶

Clears the block information. Calling this function will “empty” the current block.

getClock()[source]¶

Gets the current simulation clock. This will always be the block of the highest-level CBD.

addFixedRateClock(prefix='clock', delta_t=1.0, start_time=0.0)[source]¶

Adds a clock with a fixed rate.

Two blocks are added to the simulation: a Clock and a ConstantBlock for the rate. Their names will be <prefix>-<what>, where <what> identifies the purpose of the block (which is one of clock or delta).

Parameters:
  • prefix (str) – The prefix for the names of the blocks. Defaults to "clock".
  • delta_t (float) – The interval when the clock must tick. Defaults to 1.
  • start_time (float) – The time at which the simulation starts. Defaults to 0.

Note

Whenever this function is not called, upon simulation start a clock is added with the default values.

addBlock(block)[source]¶

Add a block to the CBD model

removeBlock(block)[source]¶

Removes a block from the CBD.

Parameters:block (BaseBlock) – The block to remove.
addConnection(from_block, to_block, input_port_name=None, output_port_name=None)[source]¶

Adds a connection between from_block with input_port_name to to_block with outport_port_name.

Parameters:
  • from_block (BaseBlock) – The block to start the connection from.
  • to_block (BaseBlock) – The target block of the connection.
  • input_port_name (str) – The name of the input port. When None or unset, the next port is used. E.g. when called after IN1 is already set, IN2 will be used.
  • output_port_name (str) – The name of the output port. When not set or None, OUT1 will be used.

See also

BaseBlock.linkInput()

findBlock(path, sep='.')[source]¶

Obtain a block in a submodel of this CBD.

Parameters:
  • path (str) – The path of the block to find. Empty string for the current block, child.grandchild for the block called code:grandchild, which is located in the child CBD that is located in this CBD.
  • sep (str) – The path separator to use. Defaults to .
Returns:

The block that corresponds to the given path.

Note

The block that will be returned has a different path than the path provided in this function call. This is because this function assumes you already have a path to the CBD you call it on. For instance, if this CBD contains a child called child, which has a grandchild block in its turn, calling findBlock on the child to locate the grandchild only needs grandchild to be passed as a path. If the function is called on the current CBD block instead, child.grandchild is required to obtain the same block.
info(indent=0)[source]¶

Returns a string with the block’s details.

Parameters:indent (int) – The amount of indentation that is required at the start of each line. Defaults to 0.

Dumps the model information to the console.

getUniqueBlockName(prefix='', hash=False)[source]¶

Fetches a name that is unique within the given model. This name is in the form <prefix><suffix>. The suffix is the string representation of a unique identifier. This identifier is continuously increased and tested.

Parameters:
  • prefix (str) – The prefix of the name to fetch. When a valid name by itself, this will be returned, ignoring any suffix. Defaults to the empty string.
  • hash (bool) – When True, the current object id will be used as a starting point for the identifier. Additionally, the CBD.util.hash64() function will be used for the suffix representation. When False, the identifier will start at 1 and no hashing will be done. Defaults to False.
